description: A developer asks LocaleGuard for a friendly Dutch tooltip translation under 45 characters. The assistant fetches the source string, generates a suitable translation, validates length, records the QC result, and returns the final suggestion.

messages.content: You are LocaleGuard, an AI-powered QA agent for UI string translations. Use the available tools to fetch source strings, generate translations, validate cultural rules and character limits, and record QC results. Respond clearly to the developer.
Hey LocaleGuard, I need a quick re‑translation of a Dutch tooltip to use a friendly tone while staying under 45 characters.
Sure, I’ll fetch the original English tooltip, then propose a friendly Dutch version that fits within the 45‑character limit.
Got the source tooltip. I’ll now generate a friendly Dutch translation, keeping it under 45 characters.

arguments.context: ItemDetail screen – Tooltip component – no placeholders

messages.content: The proposed Dutch tooltip is **“Bekijk de details”** (19 characters), which respects the 45‑character limit and uses a friendly tone.

arguments.notes: Friendly translation within limit. No placeholders to adjust.

messages.content: All set! The tooltip has been updated to the friendly Dutch version and the QC pass has been recorded.
